minify_html.label: Minify HTML
minify_html.comment: WARNING! Use validator to check your pages code before using our extension. You must have error-free HTML code if you want minification to work.

enabled.label: Minify HTML
enabled.comment:
Enables or disables HTML minification.
WARNING! Before you enable this option you must have valid HTML code on all of the pages on your site. Use W3C Validator to check.

max_minification.label: Enable Maximum Minification
max_minification.comment:
Enables or disables Maximum HTML Minification.
WARNING! Slower and unsafe. See tooltip for more information.
max_minification.tooltip: If you enable this option all multiple spaces will be eliminated and replaced with one space. All new line characters will be substituted with one space character. Your entire code will be on one line. This is not recommended, you should keep this option disabled.

compatibility.label: Enable Cache Compatibility Mode
compatibility.comment:
Enables or disables Cache Compatibility Mode.
WARNING! You should enable this if you use third party FPC or Varnish cache extensions.

minify_css_js.label: Minify CSS and JavaScript
minify_css_js.comment:
WARNING! Use validators to check your pages code before using our extension. You must have error-free code in your CSS and JS files if you want minification to work.

1. Enable System > Configuration > Developer > CSS Settings > Merge CSS Files
2. Enable System > Configuration > Developer > JavaScript Settings > Merge JavaScript Files
3. Flush and Refresh Magento cache System > Cache Management
4. Visit several pages of your site on the frontend and wait for them to fully load. (Visit home page, one CMS page, one category page, one product page, cart page, and checkout page. This is done so Magento default merger can merge CSS and JS files, and some extensions add CSS and/or JS files only on specific pages not globally.)
5. Click Minify button and wait for CSS/JS files to be minified.
6. If you are using Expires header for CSS and JS files remember to empty your web browser's cache.
7. If you are using CDN make sure you flush/empty CDN cache.

(Our extension scans following directories:
/media/css/
/media/css_secure/
/media/js/
for CSS and JS files and minifies them. If after minification your pages break or show any errors, just delete all files from above mentioned directories. This happens when there are errors in CSS and JS files. Use validators to check your CSS and JS code, find errors and fix them before you use our extension.)

remove_comments.label: Remove Important Comments
remove_comments.comment: WARNING! See tooltip for more information.
remove_comments.tooltip: If you enable this option important comments will be removed. Sometimes important comments hold copyright information and removing them is considered copyright infringement violation. If you are sure your CSS and JS files do not have important comments with copyright information you can enable this option.
